description: From Ottoman Turkish قلپاق‎ (Turkish kalpak),, from Proto-Turkic or from Middle Persian kwlʾp̄k' (kulāfak, “little cap; calyx”), diminutive of kwlʾp̄ (kulāf, “cap, bonnet”), (Persian کلاهک‎ (kolâhak), diminutive of کلاه‎ (kolâh, “hat”)), or from Common Turkic *kalpak. Doublet of kolpik.

entries.meaning: A kind of cap from Turkic countries, with a high crown.
